intro: Stenomesson parvulum, commonly known as the smallflower stenomesson, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as small, narrow leaves to reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies. Stenomesson parvulum is often found in rocky soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
